decks.notes: This deck revolves around casting cheap spells to trigger the Arclight Phoenix's ability, allowing it to return from the graveyard to the battlefield. The deck includes a mix of cantrips, removal spells, and card draw to efficiently cycle through the deck and consistently bring back the Phoenix. Additionally, there are disruptive elements like Ashiok, Dream Render and Spell Pierce to control the opponent's plays while maintaining a fast and aggressive game plan. Hall of Storm Giants provides a powerful finisher, and Temporal Trespass can provide additional value in the late game.

The deck focuses on creating a life gain combo with Aetherflux Reservoir and Amalia Benavides Aguirre. It utilizes creatures like Fauna Shaman and Chord of Calling to search for key combo pieces while gaining life through cards like Prosperous Innkeeper and Wildgrowth Walker. Return to the Ranks and Collected Company allow for mass creature recursion, while Selfless Savior provides protection for key combo pieces. The deck also includes a mix of lands to help with mana fixing and to ensure the consistency of the combo strategy.

The deck revolves around utilizing Amalia Benavides Aguirre as a central piece to gain life and trigger various synergies. By assembling a board presence with creatures like Wildgrowth Walker and Lunarch Veteran, the deck aims to gain incremental advantage and eventually combo off with Aetherflux Reservoir. Collected Company and Chord of Calling help tutor for key creatures, while cards like Dina, Soul Steeper and Extraction Specialist disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes protection with Selfless Savior and disruption with Skyclave Apparition to maintain board control.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on putting strong pressure on the opponent early in the game with aggressive creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Vein Ripper. The deck also includes disruption in the form of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord helps to boost your creatures and provide additional value. The deck aims to close out the game quickly with a mix of efficient threats and disruptive elements.

This mono black control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Heartless Act. The deck also aims to generate card advantage with cards like Liliana of the Veil and Geier Reach Sanitarium. Waste Not is used to take advantage of opponent's discarding cards, while Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Aclazotz, Deepest Betrayal are powerful win conditions that can take over the game if left unchecked. The deck aims to grind out the opponent and outvalue them to secure the win.

This deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent's hand and resources, using cards like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Liliana of the Veil. Waste Not and Geier Reach Sanitarium allow for card advantage through discarding and drawing. Reckoner Bankbuster and Sheoldred's Edict help control the board, while Aclazotz, Deepest Betrayal and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse offer powerful late-game threats. Field of Ruin and Castle Locthwain provide additional utility and card advantage. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through resource denial and attrition.

This UW Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful control spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain board control. With cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Dovin's Veto, the deck aims to counter threats and generate card advantage while clearing the board with Supreme Verdict. The inclusion of cards like Jwari Disruption and March of Otherworldly Light provide additional disruption and removal options. The deck also utilizes the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad to generate extra value from its many permanents, ensuring long-term card advantage and control over the game.

The deck focuses on fast, aggressive creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It includes a mix of creatures with abilities that can deal damage quickly, along with burn spells to finish off opponents or clear blockers. The mana base is designed to support the deck's red and green mana requirements, with lands that can enter untapped for efficient plays. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion adds an additional creature to help with aggression and provides a mana boost if needed.

This deck aims to quickly deploy Arclight Phoenixes from the graveyard to overwhelm the opponent with repeated attacks. Using instant spells and cheap cantrips to trigger the Phoenix's ability, while also disrupting the opponent with counterspells and removal to protect the Phoenixes. The deck is focused on aggression and card advantage, utilizing the graveyard as a resource to maintain pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Proft's Eidetic Memory and Temporal Trespass provide additional ways to take advantage of the Phoenix's recurring presence.

The deck focuses on aggressive play with a combination of powerful creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. It aims to quickly establish a strong board presence and apply constant pressure to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. By using efficient removal spells and hand disruption, the deck can disrupt the opponent's game plan and clear the way for its aggressive creatures to deal damage and secure the win. The deck's strategy is to maintain tempo and dictate the pace of the game through a combination of threats and disruption.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo using Amalia Benavides Aguirre and other creatures to generate life gain, triggering abilities like Aetherflux Reservoir to deal damage to opponents. Return to the Ranks and Chord of Calling help to bring back key creatures, while cards like Voice of Resurgence and Wildgrowth Walker provide value and protection. The deck also incorporates mana fixing and ramp with lands like Temple Garden and creatures like Prosperous Innkeeper. Overall, the strategy revolves around creating a board presence and gaining life to set up for a decisive combo finish.
